abstract.text: Understand the purpose and vision behind ZeroSettleKit.

inlineContent.text: Mobile game developers face significant challenges when it comes to payment processing and revenue distribution:
High Payment Fees
- Traditional payment processors charge 2-5% per transaction, plus additional fees for international transfers
Slow Settlements
- Payments can take days or weeks to settle, especially for international transactions
Complex Revenue Splits
- Distributing revenue among multiple stakeholders (developers, publishers, content creators) requires custom infrastructure
Limited Payment Options
- Players in many regions lack access to credit cards or traditional payment methods
Currency Conversion Headaches
- International transactions involve multiple currency conversions and exchange rate risks
ZeroSettleKit provides a modern payment infrastructure built on blockchain technology that solves these problems:
Stablecoin payments settle in seconds on blockchain networks like Solana, with transaction fees measured in fractions of a cent. No more waiting for payment processors or banks.
Define payout tables that automatically split revenue among multiple recipients. Whether you’re sharing revenue with:
Content creators
Tournament winners
Development partners
Publishers
Service providers
ZeroSettleKit handles the distribution automatically, in real-time, with complete transparency.
You don’t need to become a blockchain expert to use ZeroSettleKit. The framework abstracts away the complexity:
No Seed Phrases
- Users authenticate with phone numbers via Privy
Embedded Wallets
- Wallets are created and managed automatically
Familiar Payment Methods
- Users pay with Apple Pay, credit cards, or other familiar methods
Automatic Conversion
- Fiat payments are automatically converted to stablecoins (USDC)
Unlike many Web3 SDKs that are web-first, ZeroSettleKit is designed specifically for native iOS apps:
Swift-native API with async/await support
SwiftUI components for common workflows
Seamless integration with Apple Pay and other iOS features
Works great with both UIKit and SwiftUI apps
A multiplayer game wants to run tournaments with prize pools:
Players contribute to the prize pool using Apple Pay
Payments are converted to USDC and pooled in a tournament wallet
When the tournament ends, ZeroSettleKit automatically distributes prizes to winners
Winners can withdraw their winnings instantly or use them for in-game purchases
A game with user-generated content wants to share revenue with creators:
Players purchase creator-made items using Apple Pay
ZeroSettleKit automatically splits revenue:
70% to the creator
20% to the game developer
10% to the platform
All parties receive payments instantly, with full transparency
A game studio in one country wants to pay contractors in another:
Studio deposits funds using their local payment method
Funds are converted to USDC stablecoin
Contractors receive payments instantly in USDC
Contractors can withdraw to their local currency or keep as stablecoins
ZeroSettleKit is built on these foundational principles:
The API is designed to be intuitive and Swift-native. If you can work with URLSession or Core Data, you can work with ZeroSettleKit.
Users own their wallets and data. ZeroSettleKit doesn’t custody user funds or require invasive KYC processes for basic functionality.
While ZeroSettleKit works great out of the box, every component is customizable. Bring your own payment processor, add custom blockchain support, or integrate with your existing infrastructure.
ZeroSettleKit is built for real products, with comprehensive error handling, security best practices, and detailed logging for debugging.
